Justification: The presence of jaundice, dark urine, pale stools, and abdominal discomfort suggests liver involvement, which could be due to hepatitis.
The symptoms of jaundice, dark urine, and pale stools may indicate a blockage in the bile duct, possibly due to gallstones.
The yellowing of the skin and eyes could also be due to increased breakdown of red blood cells, leading to elevated bilirubin levels.
